block.p: Joe Sharkey's Aug. 16 Business Travel column reminded us of the lack of vision in Washington when it comes to financing alternatives to cars and planes. Having recently returned from three weeks riding on Japan's superb trains, I am disgusted with the penny-pinching attitude toward passenger rail service in this country. Let's cancel a Pentagon weapons system or two and build a world-class rail system, thereby increasing national security by reducing dependence on foreign oil and giving our airlines some competition.
